ingredients: 2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts (pounded to 3/4-inch thickness)
elaboration:
1: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
2: Season the chicken breasts liberally on both sides with the salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Arrange in a single layer in the prepared baking dish.
3: Stir together the mayonnaise and Greek yogurt in a small bowl. Spread the mixture evenly over the tops of the chicken breasts.

ingredients: 2 cans red enchilada sauce (10 oz. per can plus more for serving (optional))
1 can black beans (13.5 oz. per can drained and rinsed)
1 can Hatch mild diced green chiles (4 oz. per can)
12 soft corn tortillas (6-inch diameter) fresh cilantro (optional for garnish)
elaboration:
1: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
2: Spoon about 1/2 cup of enchilada sauce into a 9x13-inch baking dish and spread evenly across the bottom. Set aside.
3: Finely chop the red onion and bell pepper. Remove the seeds from the jalapeno and finely dice. Mince the garlic.

ingredients: 4 cups marinara sauce (4 cups is about 36 oz.)
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese (1/2 cup is about 2 oz.)
1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese (for ricotta mixture)
elaboration:
1: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
2: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.
3: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add a generous pinch of salt.
4: Once boiling, add the spaghetti to the water.
5: Cook, stirring occasionally, until the pasta is al dente, 9-10 minutes. 
6: Drain the pasta in a large colander, and rinse thoroughly with cold water.

ingredients: 2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts (about 4 chicken breasts)
elaboration:
1: Preheat the oven to 425°F.
2: Line a large sheet pan with parchment paper.
3: Combine the onion powder, garlic powder, dried oregano, black pepper, dried thyme, cayenne, paprika, and salt in a medium mixing bowl or shallow baking dish.

ingredients: 1 tablespoon orange zest (1-2 oranges for 1 Tbsp. zest)
3 tablespoons orange juice (1 orange for 3 Tbsp. juice)
elaboration:
1: Cut chicken into 1-inch pieces. Combine chicken, salt, and cornstarch in a medium bowl and set aside while you prepare other ingredients.
2: Combine vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small bowl. Zest and juice the orange, and combine in a small bowl. Thinly slice green onions on a diagonal and set aside for serving.
3: Heat a dry, large, heavy-bottomed saute pan over medium-high heat. Once hot, add the oil, swirling to coat bottom. Add chicken and spread pieces to a single layer. Cook until well-browned on underside, 2-3 minutes. Turn pieces over and cook until browned on second side, 2-3 minutes. Transfer chicken to a bowl.
4: Reduce heat to medium and add vinegar-sugar mixture to pan. Bring to a boil, stirring; then cook until thickened slightly, about 30 seconds. Add zest and juice and return chicken to pan; cook, stirring, until sauce thickens and coats chicken.
5: Sprinkle chicken with reserved green onions and serve immediately.

ingredients: 4 boneless skinless chicken breasts (4 oz. each)
elaboration:
1: Preheat the oven to 425°F.
2: Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. Set aside.
3: Pound the chicken breasts gently to tenderize them.

nameRecipe: Slow Cooker Smoky Ham and White Bean Soup
ingredients: 2 leeks (white and light green parts only)
1 pound dried Great Northern beans (or navy beans)
1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper (for soup)
freshly ground black pepper (for serving optional)
1/2 cup chopped flat leaf parsley salt (for serving optional)
freshly ground black pepper (for serving optional)
elaboration:
1: Trim and rinse leeks. Cut leeks, carrots, and celery into 1/2-inch dice. Mince garlic. (Pro Tip: Trim roots and dark green ends of leeks. Split leeks lengthwise, then rinse in a bowl of water (or under the faucet) to release any dirt.)
2: Heat olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add leeks, carrots, and celery and cook, stirring, until softened, about 6 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, 2 minutes.
3: Rinse beans in a fine strainer, and pick through to remove any stones. Add beans to a 6- to 8-qt. slow cooker along with vegetables, bay leaf, salt, pepper, thyme, chicken broth, water, and ham hock; stir.

ingredients: 2 butternut squash (medium peeled and deseeded about 40 oz. total)
4 cups vegetable broth (or chicken broth for soup)
1 cup vegetable broth (or chicken broth if necessary for thinning)
elaboration:
1: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
2: Cut the squash into 1-inch cubes. Cut the onion and carrot into 1/2-inch pieces, and smash the garlic clove.
3: Heat the oil in a large oven-safe pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Once oil is shimmering, add onion, carrot, and garlic. Cook, stirring frequently, until vegetables are lightly golden, 5-6 minutes.

ingredients: 1 box no boil lasagna (12 oz. per box egg-free)
4 cups marinara sauce (4 cups is about 36 oz.)
1 package frozen spinach (10 oz. per package thawed and well drained)
elaboration:
1: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
2: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.
3: Place the tofu, olive oil, lemon juice, nutritional yeast, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and Italian seasoning in a large mixing bowl. Mash with your hands until it reaches the consistency of ricotta cheese. Adjust olive oil and seasonings to desired consistency and taste.

ingredients: 3/4 teaspoon salt (plus more for pasta water)
1 cup marinara sauce (for top of dish)
1 cup vegan Parmesan cheese (optional for top of dish)
elaboration:
1: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
2: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.
3: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add a generous pinch of salt. Once boiling, add the ziti to the water. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the pasta is al dente, 9-10 minutes. Drain the pasta in a large colander, and rinse thoroughly with cold water. While the pasta cooks, prepare the tofu ricotta.

ingredients: 1 1/2 cups unsweetened almond milk (or cashew milk or creamer)
elaboration:
1: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
2: Spray an 8- or 9-inch square casserole dish with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.
3: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
